title: Docs list incorrect parameter name for torch.cat
body_html:
📚 Documentation

Torch version 0.4.0

Documentation lists signature as torch.cat(seq, dim=0, out=None) → Tensor
Signature is actually torch.cat(tensors, dim=0, out=None) → Tensor

Example REPL output:

import torch
x = torch.randn(2, 3)
torch.cat(seq=[x, x, x], dim=0)
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<input>", line 1, in <module>
TypeError: cat() missing 1 required positional arguments: "tensors"

torch.cat(tensors=[x, x, x], dim=0)
tensor([[-0.6263,  0.2296, -1.2178],
        [ 1.0056, -1.3435,  0.2011],
        [-0.6263,  0.2296, -1.2178],
        [ 1.0056, -1.3435,  0.2011],
        [-0.6263,  0.2296, -1.2178],
        [ 1.0056, -1.3435,  0.2011]])
body_text:
📚 Documentation

Torch version 0.4.0
Documentation lists signature as torch.cat(seq, dim=0, out=None) → Tensor
Signature is actually torch.cat(tensors, dim=0, out=None) → Tensor

body:
## 📚 Documentation

<!-- A clear and concise description of what content in https://pytorch.org/docs is an issue. If this has to do with the general https://pytorch.org website, please file an issue at https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch.github.io/issues/new/choose instead. If this has to do with https://pytorch.org/tutorials, please file an issue at https://github.com/pytorch/tutorials/issues/new -->

Torch version 0.4.0

[Documentation](
https://pytorch.org/docs/stable/torch.html?highlight=cat#torch.cat) lists signature as `torch.cat(seq, dim=0, out=None) → Tensor`
Signature is actually `torch.cat(tensors, dim=0, out=None) → Tensor`

Example REPL output:
```python
import torch
x = torch.randn(2, 3)
torch.cat(seq=[x, x, x], dim=0)
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<input>", line 1, in <module>
TypeError: cat() missing 1 required positional arguments: "tensors"

torch.cat(tensors=[x, x, x], dim=0)
tensor([[-0.6263,  0.2296, -1.2178],
        [ 1.0056, -1.3435,  0.2011],
        [-0.6263,  0.2296, -1.2178],
        [ 1.0056, -1.3435,  0.2011],
        [-0.6263,  0.2296, -1.2178],
        [ 1.0056, -1.3435,  0.2011]])
```
